sentence: Nearing the halfway mark in today's session, here are the individual equity names with the most call and put buying on optionMONSTER's ActionTracker data system.
Yahoo (YHOO): An investor purchased a block of 13,000 March 18 calls for $0.15, looking for upside in the stock.
PoShares UltraShort 20+ Year Treasury Fund (TBT): About 21,000 March 20 calls were bought for $0.57 to $0.63, looking for upside.
That reflects a belief that bond prices will drop and yields will increase.
Avis Budget Group (CAR): For the third straight day, a block of 10,000 March 14 calls was purchased as an investor looks for higher prices.
Procter & Gamble (PG): The February 62.50 puts were bought and the February 65 calls were sold, reflecting a belief that upside is limited.
Volume, however, was below open interest.

PG fell 0.19 percent to $63.44

MannKind (MNKD): Investors sold the February 5 puts for $2.80 to $2.85, taking profits as shares fall.
Pioneer National Resource (PXD): More than 5,000 February 95 puts were bought for $0.65 to $0.70 as investors seek protection against a drop.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
